components.description: A traditional Japanese robe that can be worn by women or men.
components.title: Kimono

description: A traditional Japanese robe that can be worn by women or men.
title: Kimono

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Clothing and accessories
emoji_net_data.definition: A traditional Japanese robe that can be worn by women or men. Kimono was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2 http://emojipedia.org/kimono/
emoji_net_data.name: kimono

bn:00112043a: Consisting of or derived from tradition
Observant of tradition; attached to old customs; old-fashioned.

bn:00105516a: Of or relating to or characteristic of Japan or its people or their culture or language
Of, relating to, or derived from Japan, its language, or culture.

bn:00087291v: To fit out with the necessary clothing; to clothe, put clothes on (something or someone).
To adorn or cover with clothing; to dress; to supply clothes or clothing.
To put clothes on something or somebody.
To dress; to put on clothes; to clothe oneself.

bn:00049123n: A loose robe; imitated from robes originally worn by Japanese
The is a Japanese traditional garment.
A traditional Japanese robe-like garment that is now generally worn only in formal occasions.

bn:00001530n: A woman is a female human.
An animal of the sex that produces eggs.
An adult human member of the sex that produces ova and bears young.
An adult female person (as opposed to a man)

bn:00006125n: Clothing is material used to cover parts of the human body for protection against the environment, for comfort and body modesty, and as personal decoration, often reflecting religious, cultural, and social customs.
Clothing is fiber and textile material worn on the body.
All coverings designed to be worn on a person's body.
Something that can be worn; an item of clothing.
A covering of or like clothing.
An act or instance of putting clothes on.
A covering designed to be worn on a person's body
Fiber and textile material worn on the body

bn:00033731n: Fashion refers to styles of dress that are popular in a culture at any given time.
The latest and most admired style in clothes and cosmetics and behavior
Term for a popular style or practice in clothing, make-up, furniture, etc.
The latest and most admired style in clothes and cosmetics and behavior.
Fashion is a popular style or practice, especially in clothing, footwear, accessories, makeup, body piercing, or furniture.
A prevailing mode of expression, e.g., clothing

bn:00068017n: A robe is a loose-fitting outer garment.
A long loose outer garment, often signifying honorary stature.

bn:00702778n: A is a Japanese garment, a casual summer kimono usually made of cotton or synthetic fabric, and unlined.

bn:00028682n: A one-piece garment for a woman; has skirt and bodice
Frock has been used since Middle English as the name for an article of clothing for men and women.
A one-piece garment for a woman that has a skirt and a body section.
A dress is a garment consisting of a skirt with an attached bodice.
A skirt with an attached bodice
